xs:annotation.xs:documentation: Resume Schema Definition V1.1

It describes a resume or CV of a candidate being submitted for the job positions. It specifies a candidate's contact information, his objectives, education history, language capability, experience, qualifications and professional associations. At the end, there can be a brief summary.
Hobby Lists
It is the name of hobby.
It specifies the information to contact a person or an organization, including the person name, and his contact methods, such as phones, fax, emails, postal address, etc.
It is person name information, including the given name, family name and optional middle name.

It defines the methods to contact a person or an organization. It includes phones, fax, pager, emails, web site and postal address. A noticeable thing is that the first email in sequence is regarded as the main email address, and the second one, if existing, acts as a backup email
Postal code is consist of 6 digits, and starts with non-zero digit.
It specifies a phone number, including its area city code, subscriber number and extension number. And there is a required type to specify the phone purpose, such as home, office or mobile.

It specifies a candidate's objective. It is an union of the ObjectiveEnumType and the NameType. Its value can be either an item defined in the ObjectiveEnumType, or a piece of objective description that conforms to the NameType.

It is an enumeration of the currently available job positions in IBM China Research Lab and IBM China Development Lab. A candidate can get the detailed job positions in User Guide, or write your own objectives.

xs:enumeration.value: CRL-Supply Chain and Logistics Management Research
CDL-Linux Development, Cluster And Grid Computing

xs:annotation.xs:documentation: It describes a piece of education experience, including the school name, the degree name and major information.
The name of the degree dissertation.
Here to list the qualifications that are achieved during the education experience. They refer to qualifications specified in the Qualifications dimension.

It describes the major of a formal education degree. It is the union of the MajorEnumType and the NameType. So its value can be an item listed in the MajorEnumType, or a customized value conforming to the NameType.
It lists several major names, including CS, EE, Math, Automation, Information, Physics, and so on.
It describes a degree, including its name and granted date.
It describes a candidate's information about a kind of language, including the language name, his level, and references to corresponding language qualifications.
Here is a candidate's self-assessment of his language level.
It refers to specified qualifications, which could demonstrates a candidate's language capability.
It specifies the name of a language. It is an union of LanguageNameEnumType and NameType, so its value can be selected from the enumeration, or a customized value conforming to the NameType.
It enumerates several language names.

It describes a candidate's experience, including his project experience, employment history, professional training and social activity experience. It should be noticed that there are two special elements in every experience, one is the DemonstratedSkills and the other is the QualificationReference. The DemonstratedSkills is used to specify what skills are demonstrated (applied in or acquired from) during the experience, and the QualificationReference is used to specify the qualifications which could prove your success during the experience. An important state is that the value of the QualificationReference element must refer to an item you inputted in the Qualifications dimension.
It describes a professional training, such as the training name, provider, etc.
It describes a candidate's employment experience in one unit. Except the employer information, there are positions a candidate have held in the unit.
It describes a candidate's experience in a project. There is a required attribute isResearchProject to specify whether the project is a research project or not.
It describes a social activity, including a brief description, time duration, played roles etc.
It describes information of an employer.
It means the number of employee of the position organization.
It describes a position that a candidate has held in the position organization.
Here to brief introduce a candidate's contribution and achievement in the position.
It defines how to refer to the specified qualifications in the Qualification dimension. Consistent with the Qualification definition, here are five choice of reference.
It refers to the AwardName in the Qualification/Award.
It refers to the CertificationTitle in the Qualification/Certification.
It refers to the PatentName in the Qualification/Patent.
It refers to the PublicationTitle in the Qualification/Publication.
It refers to the SpecialityTitle in the Qualification/Speciality.

It specifies a candidate's role in a project. It is the union of the RoleEnumType and NameType. A valid value can be either an item from the predefined RoleEnumType enumeration, or a customized value conforming to the NameType.
It defines several common roles, such as Manager, Architect, Analyzer, Designer, Coder and Tester.
It specifies the name of a Hobby. It is an union of HobbyNameEnumType and NameType, so its value can be selected from the enumeration, or a customized value conforming to the NameType.
It enumerates several hobby names.

xs:enumeration.value: Animal resured or orphaned wild or domestic animals)
Knives (pocket knives, hunting knives, kitchen knives)
Open source and the free software movement
Image editing (with Adobe Photoshop for example)
LEGO, including Brikwars, and Lego Mindstorms

xs:annotation.xs:documentation: It specifies a candidate's qualifications, which can demonstrate one's capability. It is result-oriented, including publication, patent, certification, award and speciality.
Publication is divided into journal publication, conference publication and book. So for each publication, a candidate could select the content model and input corresponding information.
it specifies the information of a patent, such as the patent name and number, filed date. At the end, a candidate could state his personal contribution for the patent.
The patent SN number, such as U.S., Patent 1,000,000
It describes the information of an award.
It specifies the award level, such as First Class
It describes all kinds of certifications, including professional certification and language certification, such as IBM AIX Certification and TOFEL.
Some certifications have score, for example, the score of a TOFEL can be 630, and the score of an IBM AIX certification can be excellent.
Speciality means your strong suits, such as music, sports, etc
It is a brief description of a candidate's capability of the speciality.
It specifies the common information of a publication, such as a title, publish date, etc.
It is the candidate's order in the publication's authors list.
It describes a journal publication information. It extends from the PublicationType by adding the journal name and journal volume information.
It describes in which volume the journal publication is, it can also include the page number. For example, its value can be Vol.26, No.1, pp.55-69.
It describes a conference publication. It extends the PublicationType by adding the conference name and conference sponsors.
It describes the information of a book. It reuses the PublicationType.
It describes a professional association with which a candidate maintains a membership.
The name of an association, such as ACM, IEEE
It describes a candidate's membership to the association, such as member, fellow, etc.
Usually it is used to describe various description, such as personal contribution description, etc.

It specified skills demonstrated in a piece of experience, or a qualification. It includes both technical skills and non technical skills. For example, in a piece of project experience, both programming skill(technical) and leadership skill(non-technical) are demonstrated.
Such as Communication, Leadership, and so on
It enumerates some common used skill terms.
It defines three skill levels, outstanding, above average and normal.
It describes a time span by specifying the start date and the end date. The end date can be blank, which means it is still going on.
It specifies a date value. It can be either Year, YearMonth, or YearMonthDay. User can choose proper format flexibly.
It defines a date type in format YYYY-MM-DD.
